title: Eddie Vedder and Theo Epstein are hanging out in the Cubs dugout
text:
The stars are out for tonight’s wild-card game in Pittsburgh.
Pearl Jam vocalist Eddie Vedder was spotted hanging out in the Cubs’ dugout with GM Theo Epstein prior to tonight’s Cubs versus Pirates game.
McLeod, Epstein and Vetter: pic.twitter.com/iOwClp8ItY
— Mark Gonzales (@MDGonzales) October 7, 2015
Eddie Vedder and #Cubs brass pic.twitter.com/BdD8PU4KUx
— Bruce Miles (@BruceMiles2112) October 7, 2015
Joe Torre had a fist bump and a story for Eddie Vedder. #pearljamsofwisdom pic.twitter.com/77JYepMWrh
— Gordon Wittenmyer (@GDubCub) October 7, 2015
PHOTOS: Celebrities who will be watching Cubs game Vedder, an Evanston native, is of course a huge Chicago supporter.
Vedder’s song “All the way” has been the anthem to many unsuccessful Cubs seasons since the track debuted in 2008.
The song was allegedly written at the request of Mr. Cub Ernie Banks, who died earlier this year.
Banks even hopped on stage to perform the song with Vedder during a show at Wrigley Field:
Vedder threw out the first pitch prior to a Cubs game last year:
Watch: Eddie Vedder’s “All the way” -
